item.description:

item.title: The pink speed hump has a huge pothole., 4th February
item.description:
High risk of car tyres getting damaged or flat. The one near the car width restriction posts outside Danson park entrance has a pothole. So does the other 2 further up the road as you head to Welling High Street. I'd recon it's cheaper to fix the pothole vs a bill to the council due to a burst tyre and car damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle crossover when?????, 4th February
item.description:
My elderly mother applied for a vehicle crossover in May 2025. It is now February 2026 and still not done. She paid your outrageous Â£5000 you wanted in May 2025 for this and now she is just ignored. Jeff Hoy was dealing with this but never answers his phone nor emails anymore. What the hell is going on? Please get this done without further delay. It's an absolute joke treating an elderly person with this contempt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Anne Avenue, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo AGAIN, 4th February
item.description:
This is now my third complaint about dog poo on the grass verge right near where we park the car, in last month or 2. I have requested stencils put up twice. It's not happened. Please can this be cleaned up and stencils be put up. I have a camera that caught the offender. I also have my own sign up. But the tramps who live round here keep letting their massive dogs poo right outside my house and do not pick it up. As I mentioned before I am going to put down some paving slabs to prevent this happening again. I am fed up playing dodge the poo when getting in and out of my car. This whole estate is covered in poo, we need a dog warden, or at least some fines being issued. It's disgusting. Please let me know what I can do to prevent this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stuart Mantle Way, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All parking bays coned off, no suspension in place, 4th February
item.description:
All parking bays coned off with no suspension parking in place, this is also the same for the end of the road towards Chislehurst road where bays have been closed for sewer cleaning - this is an ongoing issue severally restricting parking in the street of which many residents pay for parking permits that cannot be used. Will our parking permits be extended?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
